bug.author: mttk
bug.summary: ptb_word_lm.py error: unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'Tensor' and 'int'
bug.description: Hi, I ran the ptb_word_lm example from models/rnn/ptb. however I got the unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'Tensor' and 'int' for line 139 in ptb_word_lm.py. I also managed to fix it, by changing 139 self._cost = cost = tf.reduce_sum(loss) / batch_size to 139 self._cost = cost = tf.div(tf.reduce_sum(loss), tf.constant(batch_size, dtype=tf.types.float32)) And it works fine so far.

comments.comment: Thanks for letting us know about this. Could you tell me whether you're using Python 2 or 3? (Although we're using from __future__ import division, this smacks of a Python 3 compatibility issue....)
I'm using 2.7, however when I commented out the from __future__ import division the original code worked fine. So it is some "v3" trickery.

This may be a 'feature' -- tensors are intentionally rather strict about implicit conversions, so I think they don't have olddiv. Try casting the int to a float. On Mon, Dec 14, 2015 at 1:00 PM Martin Tutek <denchmark-link:mailto:notifications@github.com>notifications@github.com</denchmark-link>
wrote:
I'm using 2.7, however when I commented out the from future import division the original code worked fine. So it is some "v3" trickery. â€” Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub #506 (comment) .

Attempt 1: from __future__ import division self._cost = cost = tf.reduce_sum(loss) / float(batch_size)
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'Tensor' and 'float'
Attempt 2. maybe numpy? from __future__ import division self._cost = cost = tf.reduce_sum(loss) / np.array(batch_size, dtype=np.float32)
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'Tensor' and 'float'
With from __future__ import division just the way in the original issue I wrote seems to work.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mttk>@mttk</denchmark-link> : what do you get when you print ?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vrv>@vrv</denchmark-link> you got it :) First I got AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '__version__' After updating to 0.6.0 , the original code works fine. My bad, sorry for the mistake guys!
